intro: Lysiloma platycarpum, commonly known as the flat-fruit legume, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many leguminous plants known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and landscapes.
